info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 2:37AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina in Henderson County. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable, and locations along small streams will become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - At 230 AM EDT, stream gauges along Mud Creek were reporting rapid rises in river stage, with the headwaters in particular rapidly approaching action stage. Locations along Mud Creek are therefore expected to exceed bankfull conditions imminently. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Dana and Crab Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
